Today, Walmart took a step forward to aid in curbing our country’s epidemic of gun violence. When the collective voices of Americans are listened to, change can occur. Now it’s time for Congress to take action. https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/03/walmart-plans-to-dramatically-step-back-from-gun-sales-after-horrific-shootings.html …

Republicans & Democrats agree, Ukraine is critical in countering Russian aggression. Counter to this bipartisanship, the Trump Admin is withholding critical military aid after inviting Russia to rejoin the G7. Tough on Russia? I think not.  https://www.politico.com/story/2019/09/03/trump-ukraine-russia-bipartisan-letter-1479880 … https://twitter.com/SenatorShaheen/status/1168975108616183808 …

Misappropriating Congressional funds for the Trump border wall isn’t simply a waste of money—it further compromises military readiness, entrenches the Pentagon in immigration enforcement support, & politicizes our servicemembers.

Robbing military construction projects to pay for an unnecessary Trump vanity project is as illogical as it is illegal. This unlawful transfer of funds was unacceptable when the Trump Administration first proposed it, & it is unacceptable now. https://www.politico.com/story/2019/09/03/trump-administration-prepares-to-raid-military-projects-for-border-wall-1479981 …

Newtown’s Labor Day Parade celebrates working Americans, changing seasons— & a wonderful community that has met tragedy with deep goodness of spirit & faith. A model for a troubled nation seeking leadership & courage.

#LaborDay is a celebration of America’s workers & unions who’ve fought to protect & expand workers’ wages, safety, & rights. We must continue to expand economic opportunities & protections for our work force.

Today’s attacks in Texas, yesterday’s shooting at a HS football game in Alabama, & even more being killed & injured in acts of gun violence in communities across the country this weekend, America must answer the question, when will this violence stop?
